column2: And as I have said and as now has come out, my predecessors did the same thing and many other people in the government.
column4: Regarding her State Department email practices, "my predecessors did the same thing."

column2: Well, when we talk about efforts to assist immigrants, Secretary Clinton prevailed upon the governor of New York, Elliot Spitzer, who wanted to do the right thing and provide driver's license to these who were undocumented, she said don't do it, and New York State still does not do it.
column4: When New York Gov. Eliot Spitzer wanted to "provide drivers licenses to those who are undocumented. (Hillary Clinton) said dont do it."

column2: And I said welcome those children into this country, Secretary Clinton said send them back.
column4: When Honduran children came into this country, "Secretary Clinton said send them back."

column2: If you look at Latino kids between 17 and 20 who graduated high school, 36 percent of them are unemployed or underemployed...
column4: If you look at Latino kids between 17 and 20 who graduated high school, 36 percent of them are unemployed or underemployed.  AfricanAmerican kids are unemployed or underemployed to the tune of 51 percent.

column2: AfricanAmerican kids are unemployed or underemployed to the tune of 51 percent.
column4: For AfricanAmericans between the ages of 17 and 20, "the real unemployment rate  is 51 percent."

column2: AfricanAmerican kids are unemployed or underemployed to the tune of 51 percent.
column4: If you look at Latino kids between 17 and 20 who graduated high school, 36 percent of them are unemployed or underemployed.  AfricanAmerican kids are unemployed or underemployed to the tune of 51 percent.

column2: The clean power plan is something that Senator Sanders has said he would delay implementing, which makes absolutely no sense.
column4: The Clean Power Plan is something that Sen. Sanders has said he would delay implementing.
